intro: Strophanthus radcliffei, commonly known as the African Crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is known for its slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it contains toxic alkaloids that require careful handling.
